CRITIQUE OF THE CURRENT SPANISH TRANSLATION  
(Organised by severity → category → item)  

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
1. CRITICAL ISSUES (change or obscure the original meaning)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1.1  id: minutes / words  
     • Original: “minutes”, “words”  
     • Current: “minuto(s)”, “palabra(s)”  
     • Problem: The “(s)” solution does NOT work in production strings; it either
       shows the parentheses to the user or forces extra post-processing.  
     • Fix: Provide two separate plural-aware strings or use neutral plurals:  
       – minutes → “minutos”  
       – words   → “palabras”  
       (If the framework supports plural forms, add them properly).

1.2  id: reading-duration  
     • Original: “Reading duration: Read in” (will be followed by “3 days”, etc.)  
     • Current: “Duración de la lectura: terminado en”  
     • Problems:  
       – Adds past-tense nuance (“terminado”) absent in the source.  
       – Breaks grammatical agreement when concatenated (“…terminado en 3 días”).  
     • Fix: “Duración de la lectura: leído en”  OR simply “Duración de lectura:”.

1.3  id: generated  
     • Original: “Generated” (stand-alone; date is injected later through “on”).  
     • Current: “Generado el”  
     • Problem: Hard-codes “el” and therefore duplicates the preposition that
       will already be provided by the separate “on” key (“en”).  
     • Fix: Keep it neutral: “Generado”.

1.4  id: ai-generated-notice-intro  
     • Original: “Please note:”  
     • Current: “Atención:”  
     • Problem: Tone shifts from neutral to alarmist; less faithful.  
     • Fix: “Aviso:” or “Ten en cuenta:”.

1.5  id: maybe-check-out  
     • Original: “Maybe go check out the posts, notes, or the links.”  
     • Current: “Puedes echar un vistazo a las entradas, notas o enlaces.”  
     • Problem: Omits “Maybe” (tal vez / quizá) which conveys tentativeness.  
     • Fix: “Quizá quieras echar un vistazo a las entradas, notas o enlaces.”

════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
2. MAJOR ISSUES (naturalness, register, consistency, accessibility)
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2.1  Plural consistency: “post” / “posts”  
     – id: posts → “Entradas” (plural)  
     – id: post-old-warning uses singular “entrada” (good)  
     BUT several other strings mix “entrada/entradas” and “publicación/publicaciones”. Suggest choosing ONE set (“entrada”/“entradas”) and applying it everywhere.

2.2  Terminology: “Now” pages  
     – id: previousNows → “Páginas «Now» anteriores”  
     • “Páginas” is redundant; the key already sits in navigation.  
     • Suggest: “Nows anteriores” or “Entradas Now anteriores”.

     • id: send-email-aria → “Enviar un correo electrónico a %s”

       – Better: “Enviar correo electrónico a %s”.

       – id: skipLinkAria → “Saltar al contenido principal”  
       – id: skip-link    → “Saltar al contenido principal” (OK, but check both remain identical; one update may be missed later).
